tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 260 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a combo involving Balustrade Spy, Dread Return, and Generous Ent to mill your entire library and put a large creature like Lotleth Giant onto the battlefield from the graveyard, finishing off your opponent in one explosive turn. The deck focuses on ramping up mana with defender creatures like Saruli Caretaker and Overgrown Battlement, while also utilizing cards like Wall of Roots and Tinder Wall for additional mana acceleration. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful finish.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize artifacts and efficient creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck focuses on generating value through artifact synergies and card advantage, while also maintaining a fast pace to pressure the opponent. By utilizing cards like Thoughtcast for card draw and Myr Enforcer for a strong beater, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggression and resource efficiency.

This deck focuses on quickly enhancing low-cost creatures with powerful auras to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. By using cards like Slippery Bogle and Ethereal Armor, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with creatures that are hard to deal with and quickly close out the game. The mana base is also optimized for consistency, with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Abundant Growth helping to ensure that the player can cast their spells on curve. Overall, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure through efficient and cost-effective creatures like Delver of Secrets, Cryptic Serpent, and Tolarian Terror. It utilizes various card draw spells like Mental Note, Thought Scour, and Ponder to maintain card advantage and dig for answers. The deck also includes a suite of counterspells like Counterspell, Spell Pierce, and Dispel to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Sleep of the Dead serves as a finisher to lock down the opponent's creatures and seal the victory.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing artifacts to generate early aggression and card advantage. By combining cheap artifacts like Navigator's Compass and Blood Fountain with creatures like Glint Hawk and Myr Enforcer, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with efficient threats. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtcast and Grim Bauble helps to maintain card advantage and fuel the deck's aggressive strategy. This Aggro-Affinity deck aims to put pressure on opponents from the early turns and maintain a steady stream of threats to close out games quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of creatures and burn spells. By combining creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish them off before they can stabilize. Cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize help ensure a steady stream of threats and resources to keep the pressure on, while Highway Robbery can provide additional reach and card advantage.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to generate value through sacrificing artifacts and dealing damage to the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Makeshift Munitions, Fanatical Offering, and Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Reckless Fireweaver. The inclusion of artifact lands and artifacts like Clockwork Percussionist and Refurbished Familiar provides additional synergy and ways to trigger damage to opponents. The deck is focused on aggressive strategies and leveraging artifact interactions to secure victories.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive plays using low-cost creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Clockwork Percussionist and Goblin Bushwhacker to boost the power of the creatures, alongside efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, this deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently. With a strong emphasis on cheap and fast creatures, as well as direct damage spells, this deck is designed to consistently apply pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent by using a combination of low-cost burn spells and creature abilities. By consistently playing cheap and aggressive cards like Thermo-Alchemist and Kessig Flamebreather, along with instant burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with damage before they have a chance to stabilize. With a focus on aggressive plays and direct damage, this deck aims to win the game as fast as possible through efficient burn spells and creature-based damage.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through countering spells, removing threats, and gaining card advantage with cards like LÃ³rien Revealed and Ninjas of the Deep Hours. It aims to control the board and the opponent's resources while building up its own board presence. The deck also includes cards like Thorn of the Black Rose and Murmuring Mystic to generate value and potentially win the game through card advantage or token generation. Overall, the deck is designed to outlast the opponent and win through gradual advantage.

This deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage through card draw and tokens. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own board presence. The deck utilizes a mix of counter spells, removal, card draw, and evasive creatures to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent. It is designed to play a patient game, steadily increasing its advantage until it can secure victory through card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. It also utilizes creatures like Augur of Bolas and Archaeomancer for value, while Murmuring Mystic provides a win condition. Ephemerate is key for reusing creatures with powerful enter-the-battlefield effects. The deck includes removal like Skred and Lightning Bolt, along with card draw and manipulation spells such as Brainstorm. The mana base includes various dual lands and snow-covered basics, along with utility lands like Perilous Landscape. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through control and resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct burn spells. By combining cheap creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker with high-impact burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, the deck aims to deal damage early and often. Faithless Looting helps filter through the deck to find key cards, while Highway Robbery and Grab the Prize provide additional resource generation. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Glint Hawk, Kor Skyfisher, and Refurbished Familiar to establish a strong board presence, as well as Cast Down and Suffocating Fumes to control the opponent's board, this Orzhov Aggro deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game. The deck also includes some card advantage and graveyard interaction with cards like Grim Bauble and Instant Ramen to further support its aggressive strategy.

The deck relies on assembling the Urzatron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It includes various control elements such as counterspells (Prohibit, Unwind), removal (Bojuka Bog, Mulldrifter), and card draw (Impulse, Prophetic Prism). The goal is to stall the game with defensive creatures (Stonehorn Dignitary, Murmuring Mystic) and spells (Moment's Peace) until the Urzatron is assembled, then overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells like Ghostly Flicker and Crop Rotation.

The deck revolves around playing low-cost creatures with abilities that enhance each other, such as Deftblade Elite and Lagonna-Band Trailblazer. It focuses on creating a fast and aggressive early-game board presence, utilizing auras and enchantments like Ethereal Armor and Solid Footing to buff up the creatures and protect them. Armored Armadillo provides a solid defensive option, while cards like Lifelink and Sentinel's Eyes help to sustain the aggro strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of small but powerful creatures.
